title: Where do farmers get their seeds?

subtasks: Explaining genes and their variations in plants

Illustrating hybrid vigor as offspring combining different genes (e.g., half hearts, half spades)
Explaining the breeding process to create uniform crops
Discussing why farmers purchase hybrid seeds annually instead of saving them

tasks.task: Describing the agricultural practice of planting hybrid crops
subtasks: Planting hybrid seeds as provided by seed companies or researchers
Collecting seeds from the hybrid crop for next year's planting

tasks.task: Detailing the limitations of saved hybrid seeds
subtasks: Growing plants from saved seeds that may vary in characteristics (e. g., height, pest resistance)
Resulting in non-uniform crops requiring more care during cultivation
